job.title: Software Engineer I
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Computer Software,Logistics and Supply Chain
job.description: Join a team recognized for leadership innovation and diversitybrbrThe future is what you make itbrbrWhen you join Honeywell you become a member of our global team of thinkers innovators dreamers and doers who make the things that make the futurebrbrThat means changing the way we fly fueling jets in an ecofriendly way keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on MarsbrbrWorking at Honeywell isnt just about developing cool things Thats why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industriesbrbrAre you ready to help us make the futurebrbrHoneywell Intelligrated is a leading North Americanbased singlesource provider of intelligent automated material handling solutions that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers manufacturers and logistics providers around the world Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment software service and support Intelligrated solutions give businesses a competitive edge and optimize operational performance through increased flexibility efficiency and accuracybrbrHoneywell Intelligrated is seeking a Software Engineer to join our growing team based out of the West Chester OH officebrbrA Software Engineer at Honeywell Intelligrated is passionate about automated control systems a selfmotivated professional and strives to be at the leading edge of control system technology Honeywell Intelligrated Software Engineer will work with experienced software engineers to learn understand and implement complex automated control systems You will be part of a group of highly committed professionals who provide expertise and ensure the success of engineering projectsbrbrKey ResponsibilitiesbrulliWork with experienced software engineers to conceptualize design engineer and execute industry leading projects from start to finishliliDevelop complete and concise system Description of Operation DOO test plans and user guidesliliInterface with industry leading customersliliIntegrate cutting edge bar code reading technology to track and sort casesliliDeliver successful material handling solutions to the customer by developing and implementing detailed commissioning plansliliAttends all project related turnover meetings functional design reviews and team meetingsliliUnderstands scope budgets and schedules for the projectliliMaintains and tracks issues list reporting to Supervisor  Manager as requiredliliCompletes all inhouse testing and emulationliliProvides sitefield reports daily including progress issues and next steps as requestedbrliulAbility to travel up to 40 work nights andor weekendsbrbrYOU MUST HAVEbrulliBachelors degree in Engineering or Computer ScienceliliBasic knowledge of object oriented languages C C amp Java and CbrliulWE VALUEbrulliAutomation programming experienceliliAbility to code in multiple languagesliliBasic Fieldbus knowledge Profibus EthernetIP ControlNet etcliliSQL experienceliliAbility to influence crossfunctional teams to deliver optimal solutionsliliClearly and concisely convey subtle or complex messages to a nontechnical audienceliliCapability to follow guidelines and ensure efficiency on given project tasksliliExcellent computer literacyliliAbility to focus on essential information and identify key detailsliliAbility to quickly analyze incorporate and apply latest information and conceptsliliIndividuals who are selfmotivated and able to work without supervisionbrliulCB INDEEDbrbrAdditional InformationbrulliJOB ID HRD136098liliCategory EngineeringliliLocation 7901 Innovation WayMasonOhio45040United StatesliliExemptbrliulCustomer Experience GLOBALbrbrHoneywell is an equal opportunity employer Qualified applicants will be considered
